plugins.name: Colorful
plugins.description:
Colorful is a powerful plugin that helps you to generate and use colors in your designs.


  • Generate color palettes from scratch or using pre-defined formulas.
  • Choose from hundreds of pre-defined color palettes.
  • Check the contrast of text by changing the background color, to ensure that your designs are accessible to all users.
  • Generate shades and tints of any color.
  • Get color information, such as hex, RGB, and HSL values.


Colorful is the perfect tool for designers of all levels, from beginners to experienced professionals. It can help you to create visually appealing, consistent, and accessible designs, and to save time and effort on color selection and contrast checking.


No matter what kind of design work you do, Colorful can help you to create beautiful, effective, and accessible designs.


Try Colorful today and see the difference it can make to your workflow!
plugins.tagline: Colorful: Your one-stop shop for color inspiration and generation.

plugins.name: FFIT Laum
plugins.description:
Short introduction video: https://youtu.be/5Z3PfCLdEeA


We at FFIT like innovation and technological challenges. Together with our partners and friends, we make technology to empower human beings, allowing them to do more with less effort and leaving no one behind - especially people with disability.


This Figma plugin allows users to access FFIT’s Laum micro-frontend live component gallery and its primitive widget components. The live components are in the form of micro front-ends with high usability and accessibility. We believe that component reuse is the main way to produce high-quality and low-cost software. The discovery of which components should be used/reused must occur at the design time. This helps bridge the gap between end customers (who can actively participate in the process - through participatory design), interaction designers, and requirement engineers. Historically, this approach, widely proclaimed in universities, encounters practical difficulties due to the low interactivity of the components available in the prototyping tools and the low fidelity of the generated prototypes. They even have graphic fidelity but not interactional fidelity. The slightly higher granularity allows more meaningful components to be made available, such as login screens, software terms of use, chats, etc. Because it is based on design system, the rendering of the screens follows the design definitions indicated by the client. Finally, because they are micro front-ends, they are running code, which greatly brings together the actors involved in software production.


Accessibility is another aspect of quality that has gained relevance and deservedly so. All Laum components score top marks for accessibility based on the code check provided by Google Lighthouse. This ensures superior accessibility for people who are blind or visually impaired. For people who are deaf or hard of hearing, some components may contain videos (for sign language). Professional interpreters do all content interpretation. Artificial intelligence or avatars are not used in this process, and this is to ensure that the correct message will reach the person with hearing disability. FFIT customers who need videos with sign language content can order them free of charge via email to: design@ffit.com.br. The videos produced will be inserted into the client's design system and can be reused in prototypes and real applications.


High quality comes from a basic fact: if it is to be reused, it must be done well. In that regard, usability is strengthened through two checks with more than 200 items based on Nielsen's heuristics, one review after the prototyping phase and another after the development phase, before the micro-frontend enters the gallery.


The components from the Laum gallery can be used (reused) at prototyping time through our Figma Plugin. The plugin lets you access the library of Micro-frontends along with its set of primitive widgets. Laum plugin also generates HTML code ready for testing with your users. This code is entirely free. It is yours.


If you are interested in trying it out, contact us at: design@ffit.com.br
plugins.tagline: A plugin built to give the desing the tools to built an even more porwefull live prototype.

plugins.name: Page Numbers for Slides (Paginate)
plugins.description:
Add beautiful, customizable slide numbers — in seconds.

This plugin automatically adds page numbers to your slides with full control over style and layout.

Save your settings as templates and reuse them later. No more repetitive setup!


✨ Bonus: Magic Mode

Let the plugin detect slide background and adjust text color automatically — for perfect contrast every time.


✨ Exclude specific slides

Skip page numbers on selected slides without breaking the sequence. Edit this setting directly in your templates.


Features:


  1. Auto-pagination for your slide frames
  2. Customize font, color, position, opacity
  3. Skip specific slides from pagination
  4. Save and reuse templates
  5. Magic Mode: auto-adjusts text color based on background
  6. Lightweight, fast, and easy to use


Perfect for pitch decks, reports, and any slide-based designs.
plugins.tagline: pagination  slides  presentation  page numbers  template  auto layout  productivity  deck  tools

plugins.name: Icon Resizer
plugins.description:
Icon Resizer saves you time in properly preparing icons for use in your design in the following ways:


  • Quickly add/remove icon dimensions;
  • Ability to generate both individual icons and a grid of variants;
  • Set stroke thickness to frame the size of the icon if it uses outlines;
  • You have a root icon component that allows you to make changes in only one place to edit the entire set;
  • Quickly rename icon components using variables.


Pro features [BUY PRO↗]:

You can set your own price for PRO features. I tried to make this plugin as affordable as possible and really appreciate if you were able to set your price above the minimum price. It helps to recoup the development costs.


  • Preserving the fill color when changing instances of different icons. Now you don't have to re-set the color for an icon every time. This is achieved through proper automatic organization of layers;
  • Analysis of icons for correct structure matching and quick selection;
  • Automatic cleaning of unnecessary nesting within the icon frame.


How to use? SEE GUIDE↗


  1. Select one or more icons you want to generate;
  2. Enter a name for the set to be generated (use variables to pass dimensionality values or the original name, this will apply according to the frame size);
  3. Select the type of generation. As individual components or as a variants set;
  4. Set the desired icon sizes and stroke thickness if needed;
  5. Click the "Generate" button.
plugins.tagline: Quickly create sets of icon components of the required size

plugins.name: Bulk Desaturate: Black & White Image Fills
plugins.description:
Description

Bulk Desaturate makes it easy to convert image fills to black and white in Figma — instantly and non-destructively. Whether you're testing tone, removing visual noise, or creating grayscale wireframes, this plugin simplifies your workflow.


How to use

  1. Select images or shapes containing image fills
  2. Choose a style
  3. Convert images


Features

  1. Supports multiple selections
  2. One-click “Select All” image fills
  3. Non-destructive fill layering
  4. Optimized grayscale presets
  5. Fast and lightweight — ideal for large files


How it works

Bulk Desaturate adds a black and white version of the original image as a new fill layer inside each selected shape. Your original image stays intact underneath, so changes are non-destructive. You can easily remove the grayscale fill by removing this new layer — or just press Undo (Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z) to go back instantly.


Each style (Muted, Neutral, Punchy) applies a different contrast and exposure setting, so you can match the grayscale look to your design’s mood or testing needs.


Feature requests and feedback

I have plans to make this better and make bulk image editing much easier. While I am working on that, hit me on X (@itssumeetp), via mail (itssumeetp@gmail.com), or leave a comment here.
plugins.tagline: Instantly select all images and convert to black and white. Apply grayscale styles in bulk.

plugins.name: Paginate — Add page numbers in one click
plugins.description:
Helps you add page numbers to YOUR design in one click. Perfect for presentations, PDFs, and multi-page layouts.


How it works


Step 1. Name Your Text Layer

Use a specific layer name for your text, or copy the one the plugin suggests. The plugin will replace it with the page number.


Step 2. Arrange frames in a Z-pattern (left to right, then top to bottom).


Step 3. (Optional) Settings:

  1. Choose ascending or descending order
  2. Set starting number (e.g., 2,3,4 or 43,44,45)
  3. Increment numbers (e.g., 1,3,5 or 1,5,9)
  4. Define digit format (1,2,3 or 01,02,03)
  5. Select number type (Arabic numerals or Roman numerals)


Step 4. Select the frames that need page numbers. Click Paginate and watch your layers update instantly!



Additional Info:

Feedback, suggestions, and feature requests are welcome in comments!

Inspired by "PageNum" by Resul Celik, with added features.

accepted.name: Neha Gupta
accepted.description: An itch to solve problems and make lives better.

plugins.tagline: Smart page numbering for Figma layers in seconds

plugins.name: Flatten for Icon
plugins.description:
Flatten for Icons streamlines your icon layers in a single click. It automatically:

  1. Removes any “empty” vector shapes that occupy the whole component but have no fill,
  2. Flattens all remaining vector shapes into one layer named “vector.”

This makes your icons cleaner and easier to manage or export. Whether you have complex SVGs or multiple vector layers, Flatten for Icons helps you keep things tidy, consistent, and efficient.
plugins.tagline: One click to clean up and flatten your icon layers

plugins.name: Pixel perfect (Beta)
plugins.description:
Pixel perfect: precision alignment made easy


Instantly align your designs to the pixel grid with a single click. This plugin fine-tunes the position and size of selected elements, ensuring crisp, clean layouts without manual adjustments.


Key features:

• Recursively applies adjustments to selected layers and all their descendants

• Aligns object positions and dimensions to whole pixels

• Rounds stroke widths to the nearest 0.5 pixel

• Respects auto layout constraints

• Adjusts corner radii for pixel-perfect curves

• Preserves your design intent while enhancing clarity


Achieve pixel-perfect designs effortlessly, saving time and maintaining consistency across your projects. Ideal for UI designers who value precision and clean visual output in their work.
plugins.tagline: Make any design pixel perfect with a single command.

plugins.name: FigMayo
plugins.description:
What is FigMayo?


FigMayo instantly converts any Figma library into a fully functional documentation reference website you can share with your team. All your styles, variables and components are included allowing stakeholders to browse and explore your design work.


Give developers the tools they need to inspect components & variables, copy styles and play with your variants and props. Easily add Storybook, Github markdown, code samples and more.


You get a single source of truth for your team that is automatically kept up to date.


How to create a documentation site using FigMayo

  1. In Figma, go to the plugin menu and open the FigMayo plugin
  2. Sign up for a free account on www.figmayo.com
  3. Grab your API key from from your FigMayo settings
  4. Paste your API key into the plugin
  5. Paste the share url of your Figma library into the plugin
  6. Click the sync library button


Why use FigMayo?

  1. Quickly share your components, styles and variables with non-figma users, it’s the perfect developer handoff.
  2. Instant setup - no manual time spent replicating information that exists in Figma.
  3. Stay in sync - updates from your libraries can be quickly synced with your site.
  4. Consolidate product knowledge from Figma & Github.


Reach us on:

  1. LinkedIn
  2. Slack Community

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma libraries into documentation websites

plugins.name: SVG to Jetpack Compose Icon
plugins.description:
SVG to Jetpack Compose Icon is a powerful Figma plugin that converts vector graphics directly into Jetpack Compose ImageVector code. It's designed for Android and Kotlin Multiplatform developers who want to seamlessly integrate their Figma designs into Compose projects.

The plugin preserves all vector properties including colors, strokes, and complex paths while generating clean, production-ready Kotlin code. With features like debug mode and preview composables, it streamlines the workflow between designers and developers.


Key features:

  1. One-click conversion from SVG to Compose
  2. Maintains design fidelity with pixel-perfect accuracy
  3. Generates properly formatted Kotlin code
  4. Works with Compose Multiplatform
  5. Includes preview composables
  6. Debug mode for troubleshooting


Whether you're working on Android apps or cross-platform projects with Compose Multiplatform, this plugin helps bridge the gap between design and development, saving hours of manual vector conversion work.
plugins.tagline: Powerful plugin that converts vector graphics directly into Jetpack Compose ImageVector code.

plugins.name: Super Clone - Copy or Clone elements in to multiple frames ( support autolayout)
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you to copy an object into multiple frames in a click. The copied object preserves its position at the destination frames. Meaning, they get copied at the same position as they were in the source frame. This works for both simple and auto-layout frames.



Why did I develop this? 


The thought for this plugin came from personal frustration :) In Figma, I saw that sometimes we wouldn’t be able to drag a new object or an icon into a frame. The object will stay outside the frame somewhere. Then we got to hold the object, and drag through several frames in the sidebar ( our frames usually have the same names making it even tougher)) and then push them into the frame wants. I wanted to have a simple plugin that will just show me a list of frames and then copy the selected object into the selected frame. 


As I started developing this, the idea extrapolated from copying to “single frame” to copying to “ multiple frames”.  First, the idea was to do this for simple frames only, but then that thought also evolved into supporting auto layout frames as well.


What can the plugin do?


  • If the frame sizes are similar, the copied object ( in the source frame) preserves its position in the destination frame also 
  • Simple frames, auto layout frames, and child frames are supported.  Copied object preserves its position in the auto layout also.
  • If you copy a component into multiple frames it will get copied as a child instance at the destination frames.
plugins.tagline: Copy or clone elements or components in to multiple frame with a click

As I started developing this, the idea extrapolated from copying to “single frame” to copying to “ multiple frames”.  First, the idea was to do this for simple frames only, but then that thought also evolved into supporting auto layout frames as well.


What can the plugin do?

plugins.name: Fill with Excel
plugins.description:
1. If the layer name you selected matches the header name of xlsx, you can fill it in, and the plugin will automatically traverse all descendant layers. For example, if the layer name is # 123 and the header name is 123, it can be automatically filled with text and image links. The text layer can support the simultaneous filling of multiple forms, such as "# (Ethnicity) School (ID) Blood Type&Phone (Gender) Address". The layer name will be filled with "Ethnicity, School, ID, Blood Type, Phone, Gender, Address" at the same time. The content in () is a fixed value, not dynamic value filling in (). Two consecutive dynamic values need to be separated by&
  2. 你选中的图层名称和xlsx的表头名称一致，就可以进行填充，插件会自动遍历所有子孙图层。举例：图层名称为#123 表头名称为123，则可以自动进行填充，支持填充文本和图片链接。文本图层可以支持多表单同时填充，比如“#(民族)学校(身份证)血型&电话(性别)地址”，这个图层名称会同时填充“民族，学校，身份证，血型，电话，性别，地址。其中()中的内容是固定值，而不是()中的会进行动态值填充，连续的两个动态值需要用&分开
  3. https://www.yuque.com/fengchuan/ptcu5g?# 《fill with excel》 这是使用教程，包含文字填充和图片填充的教程

plugins.name: m3-variable-exporter
plugins.description:
With this plugin you can export figma variables or paint styles created by the Material Theme Builder as css variables in accordance with the M3 design token specification. It exports the variable groups "Schemes", "Palettes" and "Extended Colors" and ignores the others. Optional export of text styles is possible. You can also suffix the color variables with either "-dark" or "-light", or use the mode/theme as suffix.


The created output looks like this (example is shortened):


/* material-theme.light.tokens.scss */

.light {
    --md-sys-color-primary: #65558f;
    --md-sys-color-surface-tint: #65558f;
    --md-sys-color-on-primary: #ffffff;
    --md-sys-color-primary-container: #e9ddff;
    --md-sys-color-on-primary-container: #201047;
    --md-sys-color-secondary: #625b71;
    --md-sys-color-on-secondary: #ffffff;
    --md-sys-color-secondary-container: #e8def8;
    --md-sys-color-on-secondary-container: #1e192b;
    [...]
    --md-ref-palette-primary100: #ffffff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary99: #fffbff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary98: #fdf7ff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary95: #f6eeff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary90: #e9ddff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary80: #cfbcff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary70: #b69df7;
    --md-ref-palette-primary60: #9a83db;
    --md-ref-palette-primary50: #8069bf;
    --md-ref-palette-primary40: #6750a4;
    --md-ref-palette-primary35: #5b4397;
    --md-ref-palette-primary30: #4f378a;
    --md-ref-palette-primary25: #432b7e;
    --md-ref-palette-primary20: #381e72;
    --md-ref-palette-primary15: #2d1067;
    --md-ref-palette-primary10: #22005d;
    --md-ref-palette-primary5: #160041;
    --md-ref-palette-primary0: #000000;
    [...]
}

/* fonts.tokens.scss */

:root {
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-font: Roboto;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-size: 57px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-tracking: -0.25px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-weight: Regular;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-font: Roboto;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-size: 45px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-tracking: 0px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-weight: Regular;
    [...]
}
plugins.tagline: Export Material Theme Builder figma variables to css variables

plugins.name: Typable
plugins.description:
Make your Figma forms work like the real thing 🚀


Tired of static form designs? Typable transforms your Figma prototypes into fully interactive, typable experiences. With just one click, you can add input fields, validation, and a submit button, making your forms functional and testable directly inside Figma.


Typable takes full advantage of Figma’s native variable functionality, automatically setting up and managing all necessary components and variables behind the scenes. No need to manually configure anything — just focus on designing and let Typable handle the technical details.


🔥 Why use Typable?


✅ Bring your prototypes to life

Let users type into input fields and interact with your forms as they would in a real product.


✅ Effortless form validation

Set required fields, add custom error messages, and guide users with real-time feedback.


✅ One-click setup

Instantly generate fully functional form components without complex setup or plugins.


✅ Test like a pro

Get realistic usability feedback by allowing users to fill out forms and submit them inside Figma.


✨ Key Features


📝 Typable input fields

Add real input fields that users can type into during prototypes.


⚡ Customizable form elements

Define labels, placeholder text, and default values.


🚨 Error handling

Set mandatory fields and display custom error messages on submit.


🎯 Success feedback

Show entered values on a success screen when all fields are correctly filled.


🎨 Seamless Figma integration

Works effortlessly inside your design workflow, no extra tools needed.


Upcoming updates:

  1. Adding more interactive components: textarea, checkbox, radio, toggle, dropdown
  2. Adding support for mobile keyboards
plugins.tagline: Fully typable, interactive forms in one click

plugins.name: Rename childs
plugins.description:
The plugin helps you to name sublayers easily.

What's the purpose of a plugin?

You might have many icons in your design system library, each of which has a different name for its child layer. When you swap the icons in one component instance, the color will not remain since the child layer names are different. This plugin solves this problem.


How does it work?

Select all the frames, lunch the plugin, give a name and click on the button. That is all. All the layers will change.


About me

My name is Edward Chechique, I am a Product Designer who believes in designing and building with a team honest and simple products, with constant improvement to make people’s lives better.


I specialized in developing digital products for different software companies, focusing on user experience, user interface, design systems, research, and usability tests.

I regularly work closely with developers, product managers, and QA teams.


In addition to that, I am a moderator of design thinking workshops and mentor new designers who want to enter the UX field or improve their UX skills.


Check out the video below to see how it works: https://youtu.be/zddMRhG7tYs

plugins.name: Font Variables Maker
plugins.description:
Typical situation: you've been playing around with fonts and at some point it's too late and too tedious to clean things up manually.


This plugin will help you clean up your typography. All you have to do is select text layers (and the plugin will help you with this), click a button and everything will be automatically sorted. A set of variables is generated based on the fonts used in the file and applied to all selected text layers in an orderly fashion.


Want to apply only 4 of the 20 fonts used? No problem. Want to change fonts within frames only? Easy. Want to apply a specific font to all text layers without variables? Yes, please.

plugins.name: Pagefleet
plugins.description:
The Purpose

Pagefleet is built to help you save time by instantly generating all necessary pages for your design project instead of having to create them one by one. It comes equipped with three diverse templates that have been tailored to suit small, medium, and large design projects. Whether you're working on a website design, mobile app or a robust e-commerce site, Pagefleet has got you covered. To add to its versatility, it includes a custom feature that allows you reuse and edit any of the prebuilt templates to match your requirements.


How to use Pagefleet


Quickstart

Begin by running the plugin. Under the 'Quickstart' tab, you can select the project type that resonates with your requirements. Upon selection, a pre-defined set of pages are generated instantly, setting the stage for you to dive into your project.


Custom

If you wish to customize one of the templates, navigate to the 'Custom' tab and select the template you'd like to reuse. Once your template is selected, you have the freedom to modify the names of the pages by simply clicking on them. After you've made your desired changes, click on 'Generate Pages' to produce your own custom set of pages.


Limitations

  • If you are running the plugin on a fresh Figma file, it will rename the current page you're at with the first name in the template.
  • If you already have a few pages setup, running the plugin will rename only the current page and append the rest of the pages below it.

plugins.name: Reset instances
plugins.description:
Reset the following properties of instances without having to reset the media and text content. Works with variables.


Everything except content

Outermost layer without content (nested instances will not be reset)

Select properties to reset


Dimensions (Width, height, or min/max dimensions)

Fit

Padding

Item spacing

Corner radius

Visibility

Modes

Typography


Note: The processing of instances will take more time to complete the larger the instances are. Hidden layers within the instances will also be processed. It is recommended to not run the plugin on more than 1 complex instance – the plugin will timeout in 15 minutes.


This plugin does not reset texts, fills and strokes as they are supported natively in Figma via the overflow button next to the component panel.


Source code here.

plugins.name: Symbl — Your Ultimate Symbol Library
plugins.description:
About the Project

This project is a platform designed for easy searching, copying, and using special symbols, emojis, and flags. It is aimed at designers, developers, content creators, and anyone looking to make their projects more expressive and unique.


Project Goal

Our goal is to create a convenient and functional tool that helps users quickly find and apply symbols, emojis, and flags without the need to search for them across multiple sources. We aim to make the copy-and-paste process as simple as possible while ensuring the content remains accessible and useful.


Mission

Our mission is to provide users with a high-quality, structured, and constantly updated catalog of symbols, emojis, and flags that can be easily integrated into web design, social media, documents, and programming. We believe that even small visual details can make communication clearer, more creative, and more engaging.


Key Features

Extensive Symbol Library — From standard HTML symbols to rare characters and emojis.

One-Click Copying — A fast and efficient copy-and-paste system.

Responsive Design — The platform works seamlessly across all devices.

SEO Optimization — Unique content and an easy search system for various needs.

Regular Updates — We continuously add new symbols and features.


Future of the Project

Our future plans include expanding the symbol collection, adding new tools for easier content management, improving the user interface, and integrating with different platforms. We strive to make this platform the ultimate resource for everyone who values high-quality symbols and emojis.

accepted.description: We organize design processes, accelerate the product's time to market and manage projects from the beginning to the final approval.

plugins.name: Color Contrast
plugins.description:
Measure color contrast using the APCA, BPCA, and WCAG 2 algorithms.


Inspect Mode:

  1. Select any layer—preferably text, but frame, group, component, or instance layers also work—to automatically extract the color.
  2. Alternatively, you can manually input the color.
  3. The calculated contrast value will be displayed below.
  4. Click the "Show conformance" button at the bottom to view the WCAG conformance for the selected contrast.


Audit Mode:

  1. Select the frame to run the audit for and click run audit button.
  2. The plugin lists any contrast violations for both normal and large text.
  3. WCAG2 is the default algorithm, but you can switch to other contrast algorithm.
  4. In the list, you can click on any row to focus that layer on the canvas, you can shift + click on any row to open that layer in the inspect mode.


If you aren't familiar with the BPCA or APCA algorithms, check out this article Color contrast, a deep dive.
plugins.tagline: Measure color contrast using APCA, BPCA, WCAG 2 algorithms

plugins.name: Themed
plugins.description:
Effortlessly switch between Light and Dark themes in Figma with just a single click! This plugin lets you leverage your design tokens using local or shared styles for seamless theme transitions.


Ensure you are following the same Name Token Convention. Ensure to create two folders called Light and Dark. Feel free to any subfolders you feel necessary ... just as long there is one for Light mode and Dark mode.


Example:

Light/Color100 -> Dark/Color100


How to use your Themed:

https://www.loom.com/share/bf36f3b1b3a44526bdd8b9a1e8a51e59



Using Local Styles:

In order use local styles be sure to setup local styles with the proper naming conventions.


Using Shared Styles:

Due to limitations in the Figma API we require you to provide an Access tokens and File Key.


Locating Figma Access tokens:

https://www.loom.com/share/89302449180d4de39748f6f8084fc5b1


Locating File Key:

https://www.loom.com/share/1a137ec463ee4510b0a79e5129e94e44



Once set up, enjoy one-click theme toggling and maintain design consistency across all your projects.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly switch between Light & Dark themes using your own design tokens

plugins.name: Lingohub for Figma
plugins.description:
Localize all your Figma projects with Lingohub — all your texts, in one place!


With Lingohub, you can seamlessly localize any project, from web or mobile apps to games or websites. Our continuous translation management and streamlined workflows integrate effortlessly into your development process.


How it works with our Figma plugin

•Push text segments from Figma directly to Lingohub.

•Pull completed translations back into Figma and instantly preview your localized designs.

•Context is key: screenshots of your designs are automatically uploaded to Lingohub, eliminating the need to add them manually.


What you can do with Lingohub

•Collaborate with multiple teams on localization.

•Automate your software localization tasks.

•Translate with our powerful, feature-rich editor (term base, translation memory, quality checks, and more).


For more details on using the Figma plugin, see our Help Center article.


A paid Lingohub account is required to use the Figma plugin. We offer a 14-day free trial so you can experience all features. Need help? Contact our support or schedule a free demo.

plugins.name: ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers
plugins.description:
ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers


Transform your UI designs with comprehensive analysis, accessibility insights, and visual attention mapping to boost conversions


ClarityUX is the ultimate design intelligence companion for Figma users seeking to perfect their interfaces. Our powerful AI analyzes your design files to provide actionable improvements, WCAG compliance checks, attention heat-maps, and detailed UX recommendations—all in one seamless workflow.


🔍 Key Features


Comprehensive Design Analysis using Groq and Gemini AI

- Composition Analysis: Get detailed feedback on visual hierarchy, balance, and layout structure

- Design Improvement Suggestions: Receive actionable recommendations to enhance your designs

- UX Enhancement Insights: Uncover opportunities to improve user experience and flow


Attention Heatmaps

- Visual Attention Mapping: See exactly where users will focus their attention

- Focus Area Analysis: Identify key areas drawing user attention and potential blind spots

- Interactive Heatmaps: Dynamically visualize user attention patterns across your designs



Powerful Insights

- Element-by-Element Review: Get detailed feedback on specific components and sections

- Data-Backed Recommendations: All suggestions supported by UX research and best practices

- Export Capabilities: Share insights with your team for collaborative improvement


💯 Benefits


- Save Time: Automate the design review process and focus on creative work

- Improve Quality: Create more user-friendly and accessible designs

- Data-Driven Decisions: Base design choices on objective predictive analysis rather than guesswork

- Learn & Grow: Develop better design instincts through AI-powered feedback


🚀 Getting Started


1. Select design elements you want to analyze

2. Choose which analysis tools to run (Design Review, Heatmap)

3. Review insights and implement suggested improvements


ClarityUX works with all Figma design elements including frames, artboards, groups, and components.


Perfect for UI/UX designers, product teams, and design agencies looking to create exceptional user experiences backed by data and accessibility best practices.


Upgrade your design workflow with ClarityUX today!

[3 free credits Included for new users]

plugins.name: AnnoDot
plugins.description:
AnnoDot is a flexible plugin that enhances your design workflow with dynamic, customizable annotations. The plugin allows designers to annotate their designs for better communication and clarity, with the flexibility to personalize their annotations for any project or need.


Each annotation can be edited post-creation within the plugin, ensuring information remains accurate and up-to-date. AnnoDot's refresh feature automatically updates annotation counts (at the push of a button) as designs evolve, eliminating confusion by maintaining unique identifiers for each note.


Key Highlights:


• Dynamic Annotation Creation: Easily create and edit annotations directly in your Figma designs for clear communication.


• Customizable Annotation Frames: Adjust frames to suit your project needs by choosing exactly what information to include in each annotation.


• Annotation Count Refresh: Keep your annotation numbers unique and updated as frames are added or removed, avoiding duplicates at the push of a button.


• Advanced Color Customization: Tailor the background and text colors of the annotation dot and its numbering for seamless design integration.


• Visual Tags: Use a default tag for development, bug, flow, or accessibility to quickly identify the tag or add personalized tags to your annotations, choosing your label, background, and text/border colors for distinct visibility.


• Enhanced Design Clarity: Improve your design workflow with informative and aesthetically pleasing annotations, which will enhance team communication and project understanding.


This was done as a passion project. I’m a designer who likes to dabble in coding. Please reach out with any issues you encounter, and I will do my best to update the plugin accordingly.
plugins.tagline: Annotate, Customize, Refresh: Design Clarity Made Easy

plugins.name: Create Icon Sets
plugins.description:
Create Icon Sets


It's dead simple.

select frames -> run the plugin -> save hours.


neatly organizes the component sets and sorts them alphabetically.


How it works:

frame names *must* include at least one / , \ or : and anything before is used to group the components.


arrow-right/filled

arrow-right/outline


arrow-left:filled

arrow-left:outline


arrow-left\filled

arrow-left\outline


gets combined into arrow-right component set with the property values "filled" and "outline"


Support & Feature Request

Find me on X -> @0xa3k5

Create a new issue on -> Github
